newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: S.Lanka stocks end flat, cheap shares dominate.
newsitem.headline: S.Lanka stocks end flat, cheap shares dominate.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed flat on Friday in trade dominated by cheaper counters, brokers said.

The all share index closed 0.1 point lower at 848.8, with gainers outnumbering losers by 34 to 27. Among highly capitalised blue-chips, Development Finance fell 14.75 rupees to 300.25, and Hayleys rose 12.50 to 287.5.
"The contradicting price movements between Development Finance and Hayleys kept the all share on an even keel," said a broker who declined to be identified.
Turnover was 87.5 million rupees, supported by 100,000 Hayleys shares, 1.2 million Asia Capital, 100,000 Kegalle Plantations, and 100,000 Sapath Bank.
